title: React
description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

chapters.title: Introduction
chapters.details: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It is maintained by Facebook and a community of individual developers and companies.

chapters.title: JSX
chapters.details: JSX is a syntax extension to JavaScript. It looks like HTML but has full power of JavaScript.

chapters.title: Components
chapters.details: Components let you split UI into independent, reusable pieces.

chapters.title: Props
chapters.details: Props are a way of passing data from parent to child.

chapters.title: State
chapters.details: State is private data managed inside a component.

chapters.title: Lifecycle
chapters.details: Lifecycle methods let you run code at specific times in component's life.

chapters.title: Handling Events
chapters.details: React events are similar to DOM events but use camelCase.

chapters.title: Conditional Rendering
chapters.details: Render UI based on conditions using &&, ?: and components.

chapters.title: Lists and Keys
chapters.details: Rendering lists with map() requires unique keys.

title: Node
description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime.

chapters.title: Introduction
chapters.details: Node.js allows running JavaScript outside the browser.

chapters.title: NPM
chapters.details: NPM is the package manager for Node.js.

chapters.title: Modules
chapters.details: Modules help structure code into reusable parts.

chapters.title: HTTP
chapters.details: Node.js can create HTTP servers using http module.

chapters.title: Express
chapters.details: Express is a lightweight web framework for Node.js.

chapters.title: MongoDB
chapters.details: MongoDB is a NoSQL database storing JSON-like documents.

chapters.title: Mongoose
chapters.details: Mongoose provides schema-based modeling for MongoDB.

title: Azure
description: Azure is a cloud computing service created by Microsoft.

chapters.title: Introduction
chapters.details: Azure enables building, deploying, and managing cloud apps.

chapters.title: Azure Portal
chapters.details: The Azure Portal is used to manage cloud resources.

chapters.title: Azure CLI
chapters.details: Azure CLI enables command-line management of resources.

chapters.title: Azure PowerShell
chapters.details: PowerShell provides scripting for Azure automation.

chapters.title: Azure SDK
chapters.details: Azure SDK offers libraries for building cloud apps.

chapters.title: Azure Resource Manager
chapters.details: ARM is a management layer for Azure resources.

chapters.title: ARM Templates
chapters.details: JSON-based templates to automate Azure deployments.

chapters.title: ARM Template Functions
chapters.details: Functions help automate template values.

chapters.title: ARM Template Parameters
chapters.details: Parameters customize template deployment.

title: SQL
description: SQL is a standard language for storing and retrieving data.

chapters.title: Introduction
chapters.details: Learn what SQL is and why it's used.

chapters.title: SQL Syntax
chapters.details: The structure of SQL queries.

chapters.title: SELECT Statement
chapters.details: Used to fetch data from tables.

chapters.title: SELECT DISTINCT
chapters.details: Removes duplicate values.

chapters.title: WHERE Clause
chapters.details: Filters data with conditions.

chapters.title: AND / OR / NOT
chapters.details: Combining conditions.

chapters.title: ORDER BY
chapters.details: Sorting SQL results.

chapters.title: INSERT
chapters.details: Adding new rows to a table.

chapters.title: UPDATE
chapters.details: Editing existing table rows.

chapters.title: DELETE
chapters.details: Removing rows from a table.
